subject: Re: [junit] [OT] Ward on Public Field - JUnit Recipes
msgSnippet: ... That fits with my memory of it also, but I could not locate it.  Maybe he ll publish an article on it someday.  Thanks for looking. ... Oh, it s all good!
messageBody:
--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote:

> Shane Mingins wrote:
>
> > Hey do you have any reference to Ward's view on
> public
> > fields? I was trying to find one (as I thought I
> had
> > seen more than just a reference to a
> conversation).
>
> It's all personal e-mail. Let's see whether I can
> find it...
>
> <pause />
>
> I don't have it any more, it doesn't seem. I think I
> remember reading
> something at c2.com about public fields, especially
> as it related to
> Fit, and then I asked Ward about it, and I included
> his response in the
> book.

That fits with my memory of it also, but I could not
locate it. Maybe he'll publish an article on it
someday. Thanks for looking.

>
> > BTW, flicking through the book it looks good!
> Kind of
> > like your mailing list postings ... only bigger
> ;-)
>
> Thanks... I think. :)

Oh, it's all good! I liked the sidebar on exploratory
testing which fitted a current discussion on the
agile-testing group.

Cheers
Shane




Shane Mingins
